title: W3.CSSCode

metadata.description: Learn about W3.CSSCode with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Display Examples The w3-panel class is used to display examples in a grey container: Example Jill Eve Adam Display Code The w3-code class is used to display code in a readable mono-spaced font. Example fruits[0] = "Banana"; fruits[1] = "Apple"; fruits[2] = "Mango"; fruits[3] = "Plum"; Highlight Inline Code The w3-codespan class is used to highlight inline code: The html element defines an HTML page. Example The html element defines an HTML page. Coloring Code provides a JavaScript library for coloring code. Example fruits[0] = "Banana"; fruits[1] = "Apple"; fruits[2] = "Mango"; fruits[3] = "Plum"; You can download the library from here: https://www..com/lib/w3codecolor.js If you use the w3codecolor.js library, you can also use the code classes described below: Highlight JavaScript Code The jsHigh class is used to highlight JavaScript code: Example
.. JavaScript code here
Highlight HTML Code The htmlHigh class is used to highlight HTML code: Example
.. HTML code goes here
Highlight CSS Code The cssHigh class is used to highlight CSS code: Example
.. CSS code here
★ +1

summary: This tutorial covers W3.CSSCode concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use W3.CSSCode effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of W3.CSSCode and how to apply it in your projects.
